metadata.title: CVE-2025-0395 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When the assert() function in the GNU C Library versions 2.13 to 2.40fails, it does not allocate enough space for the assertion failure messagestring and size information, which may lead to a buffer overflow if themessage string size aligns to page size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2025-0395` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc-bin - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-amd64 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-armel - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-i386 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-lse - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-pic - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-s390 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
libc6-x32 - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
locales - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
locales-all - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
multiarch-support - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
nscd - 2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.27-3ubuntu1.6+esm4').
